roleset.name: long for, be lacking, absence noted with sadness
roleset.note: MISS-V NOTES: Frames file for 'miss' based on sentences in financial subcorpus; adjectival 'missing' updated by Julia based on BOLT-6. Member of VNcls admire-31.2. (from miss.01-v)
MISSED-J NOTES: Added by Julia based on BOLT-1, miss-v.01. Corresponds to VNcls admire-31.2. (from missed.01-j)
MISSING-J NOTES: Automatically created by Julia as an alias file for unification. (from missing.01-j)

example.name: miss-v: Romeo, Romeo, where art thou Romeo?
example.text: Moreover, the price volatility that is amplified by program trading is undercutting efforts to woo individual investors back to an OTC market that *trace* sorely misses them.

example.name: missing-j: obscure video game title throwback

roleset.name: not hit, skip, passed over
roleset.note: MISS-V NOTES: Latter example is a little weird, but serves to distinguish the rolesets. (from miss.02-v)
MISSED-J NOTES: Added by Julia based on BOLT-1, miss.02. (from missed.02-j)

example.name: miss-v: oops
example.text: The company has already missed its initial Oct. 1 target date for completing the merger.
example.arg: its initial Oct. 1 target date for completing the merger

example.name: miss-v: you sank my battleship!
example.text: Mary missed John with the hammer.

example.name: miss-v: arg1
example.text: Looking back at the young man's attitude following the Waltham murders, Allan wonders whether a big clue was missed.

example.name: miss_out-v: some guys have all the luck
example.text: One was that, despite his 62 regular-season wins over the past three seasons in the Land Beyond the Late News, he has been overshadowed by his more-muscular mates and missed out on prizes that might have been his due.
example.arg: despite his 62 regular-season wins over the past three seasons in the Land Beyond the Late News
on prizes that might have been his due
